result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa Margaret Schmit was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Consecutive to: to any sentence defendant is serving.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice. 
$518 court costs imposed in 22CF194 shall be paid as a condition of probation in 22CF88 or judgment shall be entered for nonpayment.

records.addlTxt: Prosecuting Attorney Stephanie L. Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Melissa Margaret Schmit in court in custody and by Attorney Timothy Drewa.  Cases called:  22CF88 & 22CF194.  Resolution reached.  State is in compliance with victim rights.  State moves to dismiss and read in Cts. 1 and 3 of 22CF88 and Ct. 1 of 22CF194 and Court so orders.  Guilty plea entered on Ct. 2.  Court finds defendant guilty on Ct. 2.  Argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.

8:35 AM Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Melissa Margaret Schmit in court, in custody.  Attorney Timothy Drewa in court for Melissa Margaret Schmit. Def waives preliminary hearing.  Court questions def, accepts waiver and binds def over; State to file Information.  Counsel working on global resolution in Br 3; Court adj to Br 3.
Arraignment scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Not use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription; Absolute sobriety; No contact with Canna Bloom Farmacy

Clerk BMC; Apprs: Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth A Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Melissa Margaret Schmit appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Wilfred P. de Junco in court for Melissa Margaret Schmit. Def consents to appearing by video. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Def is on probation hold. Court sets $1100.00 cash bond. Def waives time limits on preliminary hearing. Court Accepts. Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:15 am.
